meanings.sent1: Before you wash the dishes, remember to prerinse them to remove any food particles.
meanings.sent2: It is important to prerinse your clothes before putting them in the washing machine.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to prerinse the vegetables, but accidentally sprayed water all over the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a gentle prerinse, washing away the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain seemed to prerinse the dusty streets, preparing them for a thorough cleaning.

meanings.definition: The act of rinsing something before washing or cleaning.
meanings.sent1: A quick prerinse of the dishes can help save water during the washing process.
meanings.sent2: The prerinse of the car before the car wash made the cleaning process more effective.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave itself a playful prerinse before settling down for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The prerinse of the paintbrush in water helped to prevent the paint from drying on it.
meanings.sent5: The gentle prerinse of the delicate fabric ensured it would not get damaged during the wash.
